reviews.text: Our tour manager booked this hotel and based on prior reviews, I was not expecting much. I was very pleasantly surprised. Our room was small and spartan but clean and comfortable. The bathroom was modern and clean. The food in the restaurant was excellent and the breakfast options were more than satisfactory. And the location was just perfect! The hotel is along the Lot river and a pleasant 10 minute walk from Cahors.
reviews.title: A pleasant surprise and a good value!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The grey concrete exterior of the hotel seems uninviting but the hotel has tried to brighten it with flowers. The reception area is nondescript. The elevator is tiny and slow, so be prepared to lug your suitcase up the steps. We were on the top floor and unfortunately the neon windmill sign for the hotel was right outside. The blinds are fairly good at blocking out the blinking neon light but you would be much better off to get a room on the riverfront side of the hotel. We had dinner one night at the hotel and the food and service were excellent. The dining area is along the river which makes for a very pleasant breakfast when the sun is out. One potential issue is getting back in the hotel after a late evening in Cahors. The front entrance is locked after 11pm and we would have been unable to get in had we not had some friends who happened to be in the lobby when we arrived. Also, there was never anyone at the front desk so when you returned to the hotel after walking around Cahors, you had to retrieve your own room key from the reception area. It did make me wonder about the security of our room but we didn't have any problems.
reviews.title: The inside of hotel a nice surprise

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The most pleasant part of the hotel was the patio along the riverfront. We didn't have any problems with bugs, despite being there in the heat of summer. Overall, I was pleasantly surprised and would certainly recommend this hotel to anyone on a budget who is visiting the lovely town of Cahors.
reviews.title: Nice Location - Needs Total Refurb

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: When we first saw the hotel from across the river, we thought it looked ordinary from the outside. When we arrived it was a nice surprise. Reception very helpful, our room bright, white, clean and airy overlooking the beautiful Lot River . Lovely modern bathroom. Had drink on outside eating area, fed fish & ducks in Lot River. Beautiful setting, excellent value for money.
reviews.title: Very basic - did not get a good night of sleep here at all

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My heart sank when we arrived at this concrete building in the pouring rain though I can hardly blame the hotel for the weather! Very nicely located right on the River Lot within easy walking distance of the town centre. Large restaurant & bar though service in the bar was very slow as the receptionist seemed to be doing everything. Small tatty bedroom who's saving grace was a balcony overlooking the terrace & river, and grim shower room. Coulnd't face using the shower so just washed instead. Trouble is, there's really no where else to stay near here at a sensible price so needs must! School canteen type breakfast but inspite of my moans, I slept very well.
reviews.title: Nice relaxing atmosphere

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed here for one night. Won't be going back!
reviews.title: Avoid this place like the plague

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This place is in need of some serious renovation. The bedding is the WORST I have ever tried to sleep in in France. The employees are friendly and polite, but the director doesn't care about customer satisfaction - he just wants your money. This place is not worth a single star - stay anywhere else in Cahors but here - it's a dump.
reviews.title: Cheap and cheerful but not great at all

reviews.text: I was staying one night having taken a detour on my way home from a holiday in the Dordogne to visit the closing night of the Cahors Blues festival. My room had a small balcony overlooking the river and was perfect for strolling across the bridge into the main part of town. There is parking immediately outside the hotel and across the road. I was offered more secure parking (as I drive a Porsche) but was not concerned to leave the car outside. The room was fairly basic but clean. My two gripes were: (i) the sound insulation up and down the building was poor - I could hear the toilet flushing (and more!) in the room above mine and (ii) the bathroom layout was such that I had to squeeze past the loo to get in and out of the shower. In short, this place is great for a night or two - location and cleanliness are my priorities and this hotel did not let me down.
reviews.title: Good location - not luxury but perfectly adequate

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Don't judge the book by the cover may be the tip on this hotel. It looks like a 1960 concrete block from the outside but inside it is lovely. The location is great and the rooms are pleasant, clean and peaceful with lovely views over the river.
reviews.title: pleasant hotel

reviews.text: We have a lovely, fresh family room with balcony overlooking the river. The room is simple but modern, spotlessly clean with very comfortable beds and a full size bathroom with a nice selection of toiletries. The mini bar is currently charged at a flat rate of €3 per item, not so bad for the Heineken but a bit steep for a bottle of still water. There is free wifi in the room, private parking out front and a restaurant on site that we shall visit later this evening. I have seen people comment that the staff are rude or unfriendly but I found the receptionist to be simply French. reviews.title: Pleasant hotel, private parking a real boon

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: One word of warning would be if your Sat Nav takes you down lots of steep winding streets once you enter Cahors, ignore it and head for Centre Ville where it will redirect you to a more appropriate route. We followed the sat nav and discovered it was planning to take us under a 1.5m high bridge when our vehicle is 1.9m!!!!!!! The locals were very understanding of this foreigner in a yellow bus burning her clutch as she reversed up the hill, I guess they see a lot of it.
reviews.title: Nice

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Nice room, nice hotel. You can easily walk to the centre for a dinner or a lunch. The check in was extremey inpersonal and unpleasant. The lady was more interested in own business then in the clients. But ... very good value for money !
reviews.title: River Heaven
